info.description:
# This is a DFD server Most of api endpoints aim to restful. ## Permissions API endpoints request a permission. If not described, It is public API. Permissions are described below table: | Permission | Description | Role | |-------------------|-------------------------------------|--------------------| | user.patch | Allows edit user information. | Admin
User | | user.get | Allows get user information | Admin
User | | imagelist.get | Allows get own image list | Admin
User | | image.post | Allows image upload | Admin
User | | image.delete | Allows image delete | Admin
User | | states.get | Allows get states history | Admin
User | | states.post | Allows create states | Admin
User | | announces.get | Allows get states announce list | Admin
User | | announce.post | Allows create announce | Admin
User | | announce.get | Allows get announce | Admin
User | | announce.delete | Allows delete my announce | Admin
User | | announce.patch | Allows patch announce | Admin
User | | admin.token.create| Allows create and patch admin token | Admin | ## Authentication Login is working with discord Oauth2. After login, the access and refresh token stored in Cookie. You should get from the tokens via /token endpoint. However, all requests take a access token in **Authorization** header for security. The access token is JWT statless token. Refresh token is stored and used cookie.
info.title: DFD API

get.description: Redirect to discord Oauth2 login page
Delete access token and refresh token from cookie. And register the refresh token into blacklist

401.description: Unauthorized Request. If token is expired, **token_expired** filed must be set true
